## The Black Stone in the Kaaba

The Black Stone is a special rock in the Kaaba, a holy building in Mecca. Muslims believe it is very old, from the time of Adam and Eve. It was placed there by the prophet Muhammad before he received his first revelation. 

Pilgrims visit the Kaaba during the hajj and try to kiss the stone, following Muhammad's example. Although respected, the stone is not considered divine; its importance is historical.
